English (United States)(en-US): In the bookcase. On the bed.\nBehind the poster.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 책장 안. 침대 위. 포스터 뒤쪽.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not here. It’s not there.\nIt’s not anywhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보이지 않아. 보이지 않아.\n어디에도 보이지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. You, you, you.\nDon’t tell me you cleaned?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 너, 너, 너.\n혹시 ‘청소’라는 걸 했어?

English (United States)(en-US): I did. Isn’t it refreshing?|I did get rid of the mold. Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어어... 곰팡이를 치우긴 했는데...

English (United States)(en-US): No. No. It can’t be. It just can’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안 돼. 안 돼. 그럴 수 없어. 그럴 수는 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): So my friend, the one that\nlounged on the plate....
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 옴폭한 접시에 몸을\n누이고 살아가던 나의 친구를....

English (United States)(en-US): You mean the mold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 곰팡이를.

English (United States)(en-US): Was my friend a hazard to you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 친구가 네게는 해악이었어?

English (United States)(en-US): (But I couldn’t stand the mold.\nHow should I put this?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 곰팡이의 무덤을 더는 견딜\n수가 없었어. 이걸 어떻게 설명하지?)

English (United States)(en-US): Well, Dot. Mold can be\nhazardous to people. It...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 뭉치야. 인간에게 곰팡이는 해악이야. 곰팡이는...

English (United States)(en-US): Its poison is awful for my lungs.|Just looking at its bluish form tears at my mind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기관지에 나쁠 뿐더러... 주변으로 퍼지기까지 하거든.|푸르스름한 모양을 보기만 해도 마음이 진창이 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Blegh...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으...

English (United States)(en-US): But.. I thought you’d\ngrown to be friends?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 시간이 지나며 <nickname>,\n너와도 친구가 된 게 아니었어?

English (United States)(en-US): I had no idea he was\nsuch a bad influence.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간에게 나쁜 영향을\n준다곤 생각치 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): I, I, oh, I see. I wasn’t thinking.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난, 나는, 음, 그러게. 난 그것도\n모르고 그와 소중해졌네.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, don’t say that. I had no idea either.\nNo idea the mold was a dear friend of yours.
... A dear friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그래, 너에겐 한낱 빵에 핀 더러운 곰팡이였지만.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Almost as dear as you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 나의 친한 친구였어. 나의.. 친한 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot... I truly am sorry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야... 내가 정말 미안해.\n적어도 너에게 먼저 상의했어야 하는데.

English (United States)(en-US): I could bring over a new patch of mold?\nThere’s some leftover rye bread...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 새 곰팡이를 데려와 줄까?\n마침 먹다 남은 호밀빵이 있으니까...

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you, but it won’t be the same.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음은 고마워. 하지만 그 곰팡이는\n내 곰팡이가 아닌 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if I never see him again,\nI can’t just replace my friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 곰팡이를 다시는 볼 수 없다 해도,\n새 곰팡이로 그를 대체하는 짓은 하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): (That’s... fair.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그건... 맞는 말이야.)

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t think it through.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 내 생각이 짧았네.

English (United States)(en-US): I would be devastated if\nmy friend disappeared.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각해 보면 나도 내 친구가\n사라지면 많이 슬플 텐데 말야.

English (United States)(en-US): Say, if I were to say\ngoodbye to you for good...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가령 너와 영영 이별하게 된다거나...

English (United States)(en-US): That’s different. You and I will\nnever be apart for good!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 다르지. 나는 너와 영영 이별하지 않아!

English (United States)(en-US): If I become your dream, I can live\non forever inside you as your friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 <nickname>의 꿈이 된다면, 네 안에\n흡수되어 영영 친구로 지낼 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): What? You will? So you\nweren’t just saying that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 정말 그런 거였어? 문학적인 표현이 아니었어?

English (United States)(en-US): (Something’s off. Dot seems to\nhave the wrong idea about dreams.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (무언가 이상하다. 뭉치가 꿈에\n대해 잘못 알고 있는 것 같다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Or there’s more to ‘dreams’ sent from\nthe Moon that I have yet to know of.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (아니면, 내가 달나라의 ’꿈’에\n대해 모르고 있는 사실이 있거나.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot. What do you think dreams are?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 인간의 꿈이 뭐라고 생각해?

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈.

English (United States)(en-US): Colorful and beautiful. Images that\ncommand the night. And so live on forever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이란 다채롭고 아름다운 것. 어느 밤을\n호령하는 것. 그렇게 영원해지는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): “Dreams, the eternal companion for humans!”\nThat was the Dream Factory’s slogan.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 공장의 대문에는 이런 말이 적혀\n있었어. “인간의 영원한 친구, 꿈!”

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams are what happen in your head, then\nbecome part of you and carry on forever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너희의 머릿속에서 펼쳐진 다음, 흡수되어\n영원히 곁에서 살아남는 게 바로 꿈이잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): (Can a dream... carry on?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (꿈을... 살아남는다고 표현하는 게 맞나?)

English (United States)(en-US): (Does Dot truly believe that dreams\nare eternal, based on that one slogan?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치는 정말 그 대문의 구호 하나만 보고\n꿈이 영원한 것이라고 믿어 버린 건가?)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, maybe that was just a saying?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 그건 단지 구호 같은 게 아니었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Huh? What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 그게 무슨 뜻이야?

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot definitely has the wrong idea.)|(Based on Dot’s reaction... I should press for more.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (역시 뭉치가 착각하고 있는 것 같아.)|(확신은 없지만 반응을 보니... 더 이야기해 보자.)

English (United States)(en-US): I’m saying that the slogan is for the\nfactory workers, to boost their morale.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 공장 직원들의 사기를 북돋기\n위해서 써 놓은 희망찬 문구라는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams... probably aren’t eternal.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말로 꿈이 영원하다는 뜻은... 아닌 것 같아서.

English (United States)(en-US): Huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어?

English (United States)(en-US): But dreams become a part of humans and carry\non forever. That’s why they’re eternal companions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈은 인간에게 흡수된 후, 보이지 않는 곳에서\n살아가는 거잖아. 그래서 영원한 친구인 거잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): And, if it isn’t so, then dreams...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜냐면, 그런 게 아니라면, 꿈은...

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams, dreams, they... dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈은, 꿈은, 어... 꿈은.

English (United States)(en-US): Is that so...?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음, 그렇단 말이야...?

English (United States)(en-US): Is there any chance you can stay as Dot\non Earth, instead of becoming a dream?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 꿈이 되지 않고 뭉치의\n몸으로 지구에 남아 줄 수는 없어?

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 수는 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): (I didn’t expect such an outright refusal.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이렇게 딱 잘라 거절하다니...)

English (United States)(en-US): I wanted to be a dream from the moment I\nopened my eyes. It’s a yearning I can’t fight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 태어난 순간부터 꿈이 되길\n바랐어. 누를 수 없는 갈망이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Is it because I originated from a dream? Or has\nthe vision of a dream imprinted itself on me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 아주 먼 본래가 ‘꿈’의 형태였기 때문일까? 경이로운\n꿈의 풍경이 각인이라도 된 걸까? 모르겠지만...

English (United States)(en-US): Whichever the case, it’s a primal urge. To evolve\nfrom a useless lump into a beautiful dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 본능적으로 원하고 있어. 쓸모없는 덩어리가\n아니라 아름다운 꿈이 되리라는 목표를.

English (United States)(en-US): Well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음.

English (United States)(en-US): And to be trapped in this dark body\nforever... would be a nightmare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 게다가 이 검은 몸에 평생 갇혀\n있어야 한다니... 그건 끔찍한 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Like having your existence denied?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 존재를 부정당하는 느낌인 건가?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. And I’ll have to confer\nwith Red... if possible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래. 그리고 레드와도 상의해\n봐야 할 것 같아. ... 가능하다면.

English (United States)(en-US): He’s the one who gave me a chance,\nand believed I could be a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 나에게 꿈이 될 기회를 주고,\n내가 꿈이 될 거라고 믿어준 존재이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I see... it makes sense.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만... 레드는 뭉치가 죽는 걸 바라진 않을 거야.)|(그래, 뭉치는 역시 꿈이 되고 싶어 하는 거야. 강렬하게.)
...... 하지만, 뭉치야. 레드는.

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot wants to be a dream.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (차마 말할 수 없어. 평생 갈망하던 게 죽음으로 가는\n길이었단 걸... 대체 어떻게 설명해 줘야 하지?)

English (United States)(en-US): (But is my ‘dream’ the same as Dot’s ‘dream’?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (내가 아는 꿈과 같은 걸 상상하고\n있는지는... 모르겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Are we truly on the same page?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (우리는 같은 이야기를 하고 있는 게 맞을까?)

English (United States)(en-US): But your concept of a dream\nis different from mine.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 뭉치가 생각하는 꿈은\n내가 아는 꿈이랑 조금 다른 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): How so?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떻게 다른데?

English (United States)(en-US): What is a dream to you,\nand to humans?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname> 네가, 그리고 인간이\n생각하는 꿈이라는 건 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m not sure you’re ready to hear it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 이야기하기 망설여져. 혹시라도 너에게 충격을 줄까 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams... I’ve yearned to know about them for\nas long as I can remember. I’m ready.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 것도 아니고, 내가 온 마음 다해 갈망해 온\n‘꿈’에 대한 진실이잖아. 기꺼이 감당할래.

English (United States)(en-US): Then I’ll only say this once...\nso listen closely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가, 그리고 우리 인간들이 알고 있는 '꿈'은...

English (United States)(en-US): A dream occurs only once. Once\nhumans wake it’s gone for good.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단 한 번만 볼 수 있는 거야.\n잠에서 깨어나면 완전히 사라지는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It may leave behind remnants, but\neven those are forgotten as time passes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깬 후에 잔열이 남지만, 시간이\n지날수록 점점 잊어 버리는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Only once. Gone for good.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈은 단 한 번. 깨어나면 사라져.

English (United States)(en-US): Remnants, that are forgotten as time...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깬 후에 잔열이 남지만,\n시간이 지날수록 점점 잊...

English (United States)(en-US): Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot is taking it harder\nthan expected.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 각오한 것보다도 충격을 세게 받은 것 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot... Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야... 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): You mean like my mold?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 내 곰팡이처럼 말이지?

English (United States)(en-US): That’s different. It’s...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 곰팡이와는 다르지. 뭐가 다르냐면...

English (United States)(en-US): (I don’t know what to say.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어떤 이야기도 할 수 없어.)

English (United States)(en-US): I. Think I need some time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나. 조금 쉬어도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): I still can’t wrap my head around it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 생각해도 말이 안 되는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Could it be possible that humans are\nunaware of what dreams really are?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들이 꿈의 실체에 대해\n모르고 있는 것은 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): On the Moon they said humans don’t\nrealize just how important dreams are.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달나라에서, 인간들은 생각보다\n꿈의 중요성을 모른다고 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams don’t go away,\nnor are they forgotten.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈은 사라지는 것도 잊히는 것도 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): One may think they’re buried when the credits\nroll, but really they live on in your mind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상영된 후에 망각한다고 생각하지만\n실은 네 머릿속에서 살아가는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe your dreams... are\njust too shy to talk to you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 너의 꿈들은 모두 소심해서... \n말을 안 걸 뿐 아니었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): (... Are my dreams shy?)|(But won’t they be forgotten eventually?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (... 정말 내 꿈이 소심할 뿐인가?)|(그러면 결국 잊히는 게 되는 거 아닌가?)

English (United States)(en-US): (It’s nothing like the concept of\na dream I’ve known my whole life...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 내가 평생 알던 꿈은 그런 존재가 아닌데...)

English (United States)(en-US): Can I guess what you’re\nthinking, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 마음을 지금 맞혀 봐도 될까, <nickname>?

English (United States)(en-US): ‘It can’t be. Dreams do go away.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘정말로 아닐 거야. 꿈이란 사라지는 것이야.’

English (United States)(en-US): (Silence.)|Yes. Even if they live on, it’s as a memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (침묵으로 답을 대신했다.)|그래, 살아남는대도 기억 속에 남는 게 맞아.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. Yes. I knew it. I knew it. I.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 응. 알고 있었어. 알고 있었어. 나는.

English (United States)(en-US): But... I looked away and refused\nto accept it. How awful of me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만... 선명하게 받아들이지 못한 채\n외면하고 있었지. 추악하기 짝이 없게도.

English (United States)(en-US): Clingy critter, your awfulness is welcome.|You’re not awful. We all want to look away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 정도의 추악함은 가져도 돼. 덜 고통스러울 수 있다면.|추악하지 않아. 누구나 외면하고 싶을 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Then accompany me on a journey of\naccepting things the way they are.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 곧대로 받아들이는 여정을 나와 함께해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): With pleasure, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼마든지, 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): I gazed up at the marbles being sent from\nthe crater to Earth and thought to myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 크레이터에서 지구로 송출되는\n구슬들을 올려다 보며 생각했었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I believed those glowing spheres\nwould be iridescent and eternal.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 찬란하게 빛나는 구가 되어 영원할 거라 믿었지.

English (United States)(en-US): Don’t think of it as wishful\nthinking. I was desperate.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 막연한 바람이라고는 생각하지 말아줘.\n나에겐 간절한 믿음이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Listen quietly.)|Have no fear. Your thoughts are never wishful to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그저 조용히 들어준다.)|안심해 줘. 너의 꿈을 우습게 여긴 적 없으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Fate is cruel and wretched,\n<nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 운명이 비정하고 참담해, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): To vanish isn’t something\nI willingly choose.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사라진다는 건 내 의지로 선택할 수 없는 수순이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Like the spores, trampled and\ntwitching, I can’t change anything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 짓밟혀 꿈틀이는 내 친구 곰팡이처럼\n난 그 어떤 것도 바꿀 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t even know\nhow to describe it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 수식이 정확한 표현인지조차 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I think I know how you feel.|Some fates are cruel in their inevitability.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그런 마음은 나도 어느 정도 알고 있어.|그래, 거스를 수 없는 운명은 사람을 비참하게 만들지.

English (United States)(en-US): As do most humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대부분의 인간이 그럴 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And sometimes intolerable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가끔 참을 수 없을 정도야.

English (United States)(en-US): I know, I know, so\ntry to calm down.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 혼자가 아니니까...\n차분하게 마음을 가라앉혀 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): (And what Dot would want for me, and\nwhat I want for Dot in this situation...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그리고 이런 상황에서 뭉치가 나에게,\n내가 뭉치에게 바라는 것은...)

English (United States)(en-US): Take as much time as you need. To express\nyourself with words closest to your heart.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 신중하게 골라도 좋아. 네 마음과\n가장 맞닿은 언어로 표현해 주면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): As you always have...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 늘 하던 대로...

English (United States)(en-US): I’m afraid. It’s a primal fear\ntoward endings.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 두려워. 종말에 대한 원초적인 공포감이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m bitter. Of what can’t be changed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 야속해. 바꿀 수 없는 무정한 섭리가.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel betrayed. That something I willed myself\nto believe in just shattered into pieces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 배신감이 들어. 쉬운 마음으로 믿은 것도\n아닌데 파편이 되어 깨져 버린 느낌.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. But is\nthere truly no way?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 하지만 방법이 정말 없는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): No way for me not to leave you\neven after I become a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 된 후에도 내가 널 떠나지 않을 수 있는.

English (United States)(en-US): Not a single way in this world for\nme to exist in whatever form?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떠한 형태로 존재하게 만들 수 있는\n방법이 세상에 단 하나도 없을까?

English (United States)(en-US): A remedy, an equation, or\nperhaps a machine of sorts?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 약물, 공식, 혹은 그래, 어떠한\n기계를 발명해 보는 건?

English (United States)(en-US): Well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, that’s it. How about talking it over with the\nones that woke me in the first place, on the Moon?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 그래. 애초에 날 깨운 이들,\n달의 이들에게 이야기해 보는 건?

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot is desperate... it’s hard to watch.)|(It isn’t likely that they’d know something...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (절박하게 방법을 강구하는 뭉치가... 가여워.)|(그들이라고 알 것 같지는 않은데...)

English (United States)(en-US): How can a substance on the Moon\nbecome a phenomenon on Earth?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떻게 달에서는 물질이었던 게\n지구에서는 현상이 되는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): A glowing marble, reduced\nto a mere illusion...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영롱한 구슬이었던 게 한낱 허상으로...

English (United States)(en-US): Then is there no way to change it back into a\nsolid substance, after one is done observing it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 그 현상의 관측이 끝난 이후에, 그것을\n다시 물질로 바꿀 수 있는 방법은 전혀 없는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t say for certain, Dot...|It might be possible. Go on, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 섣불리 확답할 순 없는 이야기인 것 같아, 뭉치...|가능할지도 모르는 얘기네. 계속해 봐, 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, all I’m doing is listing possibilities.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 난 알량한 가능성을 마구잡이로 나열하고 있는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Spouting repulsively as a\nmeans to grasp what I want.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잡아채고 싶은 게 있기에 추악하게 쏟아내고 있는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, right. Where do the\nsouls of dead dreams go?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 그렇지. 죽은 꿈들의 영혼이 가는 곳은 없나?

English (United States)(en-US): Is there somewhere I can live happily forever\nwith my friends, remembering you fondly?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거기에서 내가 영원히 행복하게, 나의 친구들과 함께\n너를 추억하며 사는 엔딩이 있을 수 있지 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I wish there was...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 수 있다면 좋을 것 같지만...

English (United States)(en-US): You make me think dreams might have souls.|The afterlife is controversial for humans too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너를 보니 꿈에도 영혼이 있을지 모른다는 생각이 들어.|인간들에게도 사후 세계는 논쟁이 되는 주제야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d be happy if there was some way for you\nto remain as Dot after you become a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 꿈이 된 이후에도 또 다른 형태의\n뭉치로 남을 방법이 있다면 나도 기쁠 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Trust me on this, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 마음만은 믿어 줘, 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): But there’s so much that you and I don’t know.\nI can’t say anything for certain just now...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 너도, 나도, 아직 모르는 게 많아.\n지금 더 이상의 확신을 줄 순 없겠네...

English (United States)(en-US): Uncertainty means possibility, that’s all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모른다는 건 아직 가능성이 열려\n있다는 것, 그뿐인 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Some believe the afterlife to be unfounded belief or\na figment of imagination, to escape the terror of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 두려움을 피하기 위한 근거\n없는 믿음 혹은 상상력의 산물이라고 여기거나,

English (United States)(en-US): While others believe it to be a spiritual place for\nsouls that no longer have bodies to find solace in.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수명이 다하고 신체를 떠난 영혼들이 신적인 공간에서\n안식을 취하는 곳, 즉 영혼들의 거처라고 믿는 이들도 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): There’s no more to say on the subject\nbeyond this, on the afterlife of dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈들의 사후세계라는 것도 이 정도 수준에서\n나아갈 수 없는 이야기인 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Alright, alright. I understand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 그래, 그래, 이해했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Everything is a mystery.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 건\n의문으로 남아 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): And only one thing is for certain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 확실한 건 단 하나뿐이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): That I will die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 죽는다는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): I too, will die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 죽는다는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): I will die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 죽을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be a dream, at last, then I’ll be gone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바라던 꿈이 되어서, 죽을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh but, if I am freed from this\nbody as a multicolored dream,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아 그런데, 색색깔의 꿈이 되어\n몸에서 해방될 수도 있는데.

English (United States)(en-US): won’t I be happier than ever?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼 난 아주 기쁠 수도 있지 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): But I won’t be there to\nbask in that happiness.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 기쁨을 느낄 수 있는\n나는 사라지고 없겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): What if death means termination. If everything\nscatters like my memories with the spores?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음이 소멸이라면. 모든 게\n포자와의 추억처럼 흩어진다면?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh? Hmm? Again, again. Da capo!\nI wanted to be a dream from the very start.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아? 음? 다시, 다시. 다 카포! 난\n태초부터 꿈이 되고 싶었던 거잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): It was my sole goal. Red, Edison, Sir Cello,\nare you listening? No one can deny it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 단 하나뿐인 목표야. 레드, 에디슨, 첼로 경,\n듣고 있어요? 그 누구도 부정할 수가 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s everything I have stood for.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 오직\n그걸 위해 존재했다는 것을.

English (United States)(en-US): But... for what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만... 무엇을?

English (United States)(en-US): One other thing is for certain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 확실한 건 하나가 더 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): That I... have been dreaming\nwithout knowing what a dream is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는... 꿈이 뭔지도 모르고\n꿈을 꾸고 있었던 것.
